title: Appendix – LLM-Assisted Drafting and Commentary

Analyst with cross-functional experience in legal research, regulatory affairs, compliance, and risk management across the legal, pharmaceutical, IT staffing, and insurance sectors. Skilled in due diligence, regulatory submissions, documentation, risk analysis, and stakeholder coordination.
Contact: kohli.yuvraaj@gmail.com | +778-683-4835

title: Appendix – LLM-Assisted Drafting and Commentary
text:
Professional Experience


Risk Analyst | Capital West Insurance
Surrey, Canada | Jan 2024 – Present - Analyzed commercial and personal insurance risks, advising on tailored mitigation strategies aligned with Canadian market and compliance standards. - Built risk scoring tools and supported underwriting negotiations, improving coverage and saving clients up to 18% in costs. - Ensured adherence to OSFI regulations and produced client-facing risk reports that enhanced retention and trust.


Compliance Analyst | Sage IT Inc.
Remote / U.S.-based | Mar 2021 – Dec 2023 - Ensured end-to-end compliance with U.S. labor laws and visa documentation (H-1B, OPT, GC) for IT consultants. - Reduced audit issues by 40% through digital tracking systems and improved documentation processes. - Supported client audits, background verifications, and SOP development to maintain 100% compliance readiness.


Regulatory Affairs Analyst | Psychocare Health Pvt Ltd
Mohali, India | Jul 2020 – Feb 2021 - Managed regulatory submissions to CDSCO and state licensing authorities, ensuring compliance with Indian D&C Act regulations. - Coordinated with R&D, QA, and production teams to address regulatory deficiencies and secure approvals for previously stalled applications. - Streamlined submission tracking, improving on-time filing by 25% and supported a successful WHO-GMP inspection.


Legal Analyst – Corporate Law | Legacy Law Offices
Chandigarh, India | Jun 2019 – Jun 2020 - Conducted legal due diligence, supporting M&A transactions and drafting key corporate documents. - Assisted with regulatory tracking and drafting agreements under the Companies Act and FEMA.

title: Appendix – LLM-Assisted Drafting and Commentary
text:
LLM Prompt Used

“Create an outline and sample text for a one-page MBA student portfolio webpage highlighting education, experience, skills, and a short bio.”

title: Appendix – LLM-Assisted Drafting and Commentary
text:
LLM-Generated Output
Note: The draft content generated by ChatGPT (OpenAI) was used as a starting point for this portfolio, and the final text has been revised and personalized.
Outline: 1. Header with Name and Contact Info
2. About/Bio Section
3. Education
4. Professional Experience Highlights
5. Key Skills
6. Certifications
7. Contact & Links
Sample Text:

About Me
I’m an MBA candidate with a background in legal research, regulatory affairs, and risk analysis. I thrive in cross-functional environments and bring a data-driven approach to solving business and compliance challenges.


Education
MBA - Business Analytics, University Canada West (2023)
Bachelor’s in Law, Panjab University (2019)


Professional Highlights

Risk Analyst at Capital West Insurance (Canada): Improved client retention through risk scoring tools.

Compliance Analyst at Sage IT (U.S.): Reduced audit issues by 40%.

Regulatory Affairs Analyst at Psychocare (India): Secured stalled drug application approvals.

Legal Analyst at Legacy Law Offices: Supported M&A and regulatory compliance.



Key Skills
Regulatory Compliance · Risk Management · SQL · Tableau · Legal Documentation · Data Analytics


Certifications
Google Data Analytics Certificate · Drug Safety & Regulatory Affairs (Online)


Contact
kohli.yuvraaj@gmail.com | LinkedIn

title: Appendix – LLM-Assisted Drafting and Commentary
text:
Commentary
I used the LLM-generated draft as a starting point to shape the structure of my Quarto portfolio. The outline was particularly helpful in organizing the key sections: About, Education, Experience, Skills, Certifications, and Contact.
However, I rewrote most of the section content in my own voice to ensure authenticity and accuracy. For example: - The “About Me” section in the LLM draft was too generic, so I revised it to reflect my unique cross-sector experience and specific skills. - I expanded on my professional experience with concrete accomplishments and metrics, including cost savings and compliance outcomes. - I updated the skills list to match tools and methods I’ve actually used (e.g., SOP development, Microsoft Office Suite). - I personalized the contact section and added visuals (e.g., profile photo, project image placeholders) to enhance the layout and readability.
Overall, the LLM helped reduce writer’s block and accelerate the initial draft. All final wording is my own.
